intro: Rhachidosorus siamensis, commonly known as the Siam rock fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant features a short, creeping rhizome with dense clusters of lanceolate, serrated leaves. Its fronds are typically dark green with a leathery texture and can reach lengths of up to 30 centimeters. Rhachidosorus siamensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocks or tree trunks in tropical forests.
